facts.title: Honey Never Spoils
facts.description: Archaeologists found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs over 3,000 years old—and it was still edible!

facts.title: Wombats Poop Cubes
facts.description: These Australian marsupials produce cube-shaped droppings—so they don’t roll away when marking territory!

facts.title: Sea Otters Hold Hands
facts.description: To avoid drifting apart while sleeping, sea otters hold hands—and sometimes wrap themselves in kelp.

facts.title: Butterflies Taste with Their Feet
facts.description: Butterflies have taste sensors on their feet, allowing them to decide where to lay eggs just by landing.

facts.title: Clouds Weigh About a Million Tonnes
facts.description: A typical cumulus cloud can weigh around one million tonnes due to the water it contains.

facts.title: Australia is Wider Than the Moon
facts.description: Australia spans nearly 4,000 km east to west, while the Moon is about 3,400 km in diameter.

facts.title: Identical Twins Don’t Have Same Fingerprints
facts.description: Even identical twins have unique fingerprints, shaped by minor differences in womb conditions.

facts.title: Eiffel Tower Grows in Summer
facts.description: Due to thermal expansion, the iron in the Eiffel Tower can make it grow by about 6 in (15 cm) in the heat.

facts.title: Teeth Can’t Heal Themselves
facts.description: Human teeth are the only body part covered in enamel, which can’t regenerate once damaged.

facts.title: The Shortest War Lasted 38 Minutes
facts.description: The Anglo‑Zanzibar War of 1896 holds the record for the shortest war in history.
